summary: Email chain between prosecutors and attorneys regarding the status and service of a Rule 17(c) subpoena in the case United States v. Maxwell. The emails discuss coordination for serving the subpoena to a witness or entity represented by outside counsel.

persons.name: Brian Burns
persons.context: Attorney at Smith Villazor LLP who is being contacted about the status of a Rule 17(c) subpoena in the Maxwell case. He is coordinating with prosecutors regarding service of the subpoena.

persons.name: Patrick Smith
persons.context: Attorney at Smith Villazor LLP, identified as outside counsel for Jordy Feldman. He is coordinating a call with prosecutors regarding the subpoena.

persons.name: Jordy Feldman
persons.context: Recipient of initial contact from prosecutors about a Rule 17(c) subpoena. They direct prosecutors to their outside counsel, Patrick Smith.

connections.description: Patrick Smith is identified as outside counsel for Jordy Feldman in matters related to the subpoena.
Both are attorneys at Smith Villazor LLP and are copied on emails regarding the subpoena.
Brian Burns is an attorney corresponding about a subpoena that ultimately concerns Jordy Feldman.

events.title: Court Voir Dire
events.description: Mentioned as a reason for potential delay in the defense serving a subpoena, as both prosecution and defense were in court for voir dire.

events.title: Scheduling of Call Regarding Subpoena
events.description: Prosecutors and attorney Patrick Smith schedule a call for 2:30 PM to discuss the Rule 17(c) subpoena.

events.title: Anticipated Service of Subpoena
events.description: Prosecutors inform Brian Burns that the defense intends to serve the subpoena later that night.

locations: One Saint Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email chain concerning a Rule 17(c) subpoena in the criminal case United States v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
Jordy Feldman is identified as an individual who may be a witness or subject of the subpoena and is represented by outside counsel Patrick Smith.
Prosecutors are coordinating with attorneys Brian Burns and Patrick Smith regarding the timing and service of the subpoena.
The defense was expected to serve the subpoena on the evening of November 17, 2021.
The correspondence highlights the procedural coordination between prosecution, defense, and third-party counsel in the Maxwell case.
